xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 23 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 01:33 <Guest94020> has joined #ccm 10:23 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 10:26 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 13:34 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 14:03 <ravigarg27_> has joined #ccm 14:34 <sdumitriu1> ravigarg27_: I found some good CSS, will commit now 14:38 <ravigarg27_> ok will take a note 14:46 <ravigarg27_> sdumitriu1, :D :D 14:47 <sdumitriu1> See https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/commit/75123de0401b59ab36af4f413f2c10db4ab21adc 14:55 <sdumitriu1> ravigarg27_: Do you have time to write a different distance function until tomorrow? 14:56 <ravigarg27_> yeah sure will try 14:56 <ravigarg27_> this one too basic? 14:58 <sdumitriu1> Not too basic, but it doesn't really do what we're trying to solve 14:58 <ravigarg27_> ohhk 14:59 <sdumitriu1> Basically, we're trying to match the user's input agains a string 14:59 <sdumitriu1> Currently it looks only at the prefix of the same length 14:59 <sdumitriu1> But the match could be someplace else 15:00 <sdumitriu1> So we're actually interested in a local alignment algorithm, not a distance computation 15:00 <sdumitriu1> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smith%E2%80%93Waterman_algorithm 15:00 <sdumitriu1> Don't forget to update your fork 15:00 <sdumitriu1> (to include my commits) 15:01 <sdumitriu1> Read that and tell me if something's not clear 15:02 <sdumitriu1> We're not interested in the actual alignment, just the score, which is the highest value in the matrix 15:08 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 15:08 <ravigarg27> sorry again for that, horrible weather right now in India :( 15:09 <sdumitriu1> Check the logs 15:09 <ravigarg27> I will try and complete it as soon as I can :) 15:09 <sdumitriu1> OK, thanks 16:19 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu1, Hey 16:21 <sdumitriu1> Hey kushalkhandelwal 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Sorry for the delays , finding it difficult to settle in mumbai , accommodation issues and what all :( 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Finally got net today 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> working all night 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> today 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> How are you ? 16:22 <sdumitriu1> Good, releasing XWiki 4.5.4, working on an issue, helping some users upgrade 16:22 <sdumitriu1> And now talking with you 16:22 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh nice :) 22:12 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 22:58 <kushalkhandelwal> Hey sdumitriu 22:58 <sdumitriu> Good morning 22:59 <kushalkhandelwal> Good morning 22:59 <kushalkhandelwal> :) 22:59 <kushalkhandelwal> What are you doing ? 23:00 <sdumitriu> Reading the LWN newsletter 23:00 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh
